meanings.definition: Sufficient to meet a need or satisfy a desire.
meanings.sent1: She had enough time to finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: He had enough money to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent3: The cake had enough frosting to make it delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was enough to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun provided enough light for the plants to grow.

meanings.definition: In a quantity or degree that satisfies a requirement or need.
meanings.sent1: He ran fast enough to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: She spoke loud enough for everyone to hear.
meanings.sent3: The cat jumped high enough to surprise the dog.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed fast enough to carry the boat downstream.
meanings.sent5: The wind blew hard enough to knock over the trash cans.

meanings.definition: To a degree or extent that satisfies a condition or requirement.
meanings.sent1: She worked hard enough to earn a promotion.
meanings.sent2: He studied long enough to pass the test.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked loud enough to wake up the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed beautifully enough to attract butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The chef seasoned the dish perfectly enough to impress the guests.
